subject: Re: [junit] Help, can test cases be retrieved from the package they are in?

messageBody:
I would venture to guess that you could find some guidance in JB's book (probably Chapter 4 - Managing test suites, possibly 4.5 - Scan the file system for tests),...or surf for something similar to what he discusses - Recursive Test Suite, to read a directory and programmically add tests, instead of having to manually write your 160 lines.

-------------- Original message --------------
From: "Jeff Schlaver" <jeff.schlaver@...>

I'm relatively new but this seam like something that can be done and
that someone should have done it by now, or am I way off on this
thought.

I have been give around 160 separate unit test files, instead of
listing them one line at a time.
Is there a way I can grab them from the package directory and do a
mass add of the test cases at run time?

I was hoping I can loop through all the classes in a package, since
all the testcases are in the same package.
(package com.thc.ids.application.hcs.test.CalculatorTest.tests;)

I was hoping to be able to some kind of mass add of the 160 test
case files. Below is a sample of 4 of the 160.



public class TestLabSuite
{
public static void main( String[] args )
{
junit.textui.TestRunner.run( suite() );
}

public static TestSuite suite()
{
TestSuite result =3D new TestSuite();

// Labs
//result.addTest(LabAdvisorKeywordSearchTest.suite() );
result.addTest(LabAdvisorTopicSearchTest.suite() );

// Added by HCL
result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchExtendedTest.suite() );
result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchTest.suite() );
result.addTest(LabDatabaseSearchThirdTest.suite() );

return result;
}
}

Thanks for any guidance you can provide

Jeff
